thread.title: London Stock Exchange launches derivitives venture
thread.title_full: London Stock Exchange launches derivitives venture

title: London Stock Exchange launches derivitives venture
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now London Stock Exchange launches derivitives venture The LSE is forming CurveGlobal in partnership with six “bulge bracket” banks Alamy Martin Waller Published 48 minutes ago 
The London Stock Exchange is making another attempt to break into the multi-billion pound derivatives market, currently controlled by the German-owned Eurex and Liffe, the London financial futures market now part of IntercontinentalExchange (ICE). 
The LSE, under its previous chief executive Dame Clara Furse, tried to buy Liffe in 2001 but was blocked by a counter-offer by Euronext, the Continental exchanges operator, itself acquired by ICE as part of the continuing consolidation of world exchanges. 
Since then the London exchange, which dominates trading in equities, has struggled to create its own derivatives offering. The LSE is forming CurveGlobal in partnership Subscribe now 
To see the full article you need to subscribe Subscribe
